**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-23T16:43:59Z" title="05/23/2015 04:43  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 23, 2015</time> by callumrooney98**
Could my problems flying it on launch be due to the aerodynamic issues or am i just a bad pilot?

I made a videoreview of the mod to spread it to youtube, if you want to see, is this.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FEpd8RKY0Lg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FEpd8RKY0Lg)

I'm bad making videos, I know XD!
I do suffer from this thing coming apart on launch. It also does not want to stay on its back. I will always roll right side up one it reach 600mps approx.

> 
> It also does not want to stay on its back. I will always roll right side up one it reach 600mps approx.

Probably due to you not throttling down to about 70-75% during maximum dynamic pressure, or when you are transitioning from subsonic to supersonic. It could also be an issue with the gimbaling.

> 
> Probably due to you not throttling down to about 70-75% during maximum dynamic pressure, or when you are transitioning from subsonic to supersonic. It could also be an issue with the gimbaling.

It's most likely the issues we've been seeing with the shuttle's aerodynamics, which are just being complicated by the max Q... basically the shuttle does not handle any kind of roll in atmosphere very well as we've been seeing with re entry.

Can't say for sure though right now, so I'll give it a spin on the newest dl and have a look.

I can't figure out how to launch this. It just wants to roll around and I can't keep it pointed anymore than five degrees above the horizon. Can someone please help me. And is anyone else having a problem with the launch tower retracting without staging it?
ok guys I have a fix coming up that should address these issues. hopefully today

> 
> ok guys I have a fix coming up that should address these issues. hopefully today

awesome, I applaud all of your great work
I will make a new video and will eliminate this for solve the problems. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

aw thanks Benjamin

update:

fancy new wheels on the way. just testing.

next up is the next aero fix...

also new booster decoupler

and new pointy nosecone

whatch this space

pointy nosecones

yesssssssss.

![DmSrsPd.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/DmSrsPd.jpg)

> 
> ok guys I have a fix coming up that should address these issues. hopefully today

Wonderful wonderful! Bravo! Very very small nit pick. What's the pipe going down the SRB? Is that just because they are turned the wrong direction?

yeah wrong placement.

I will get back to the tank retexture asap
With the added height of the new nose cones, you will need to make the boosters a tad bit shorter. The tip of the nose cones are now passing the starting point of the tank curve
Love the realism that much aye. No worries its good thing. How did we live with those old boosters? I will get onto it tonight hopefully

I love the model (except for IVA) and really like how it fly's when you are at slow speed in athmosphere, but it is completely uncontrollable while reentering from space. Spins like hell. I hope this gets fixed (or maybe if you need help I would be able to do it?)

@jest. Adding a ton or reaction control wheel torque will do it but is cheap. I was thinking of lowering the centre of mas to just below or inline with the wings. But the oms engines will spin the shuttle in space. This thing has always lost control for me on re entry even on ksp 0.9.

Has anyone made any spaceplane in the game thats controllable on reentry? Maybe I can copy some ideas but obviously I cant change the shape of the orbiter.

I have spent more time so far getting it to land and fly right than reentry. My last few days so far have been spent on fixing other things. 

Youre welcome to have a go at modifying it to get it to handle better. Let me know how it goes.

I also notice having the wings as lifting surfaces makes act strange when flying and having them as control surfaces works better .

Interesting. 

I notice jovzin seems to now be doing the shuttle. I wasnt aware of this. Although it seems he knew I was reworking it.

I must admit he has done well with the textures and animations.

There is no point in having two shuttles. 

One would assume that he has taken my 1.0 compatibility work and built on that to make something better. Who knows.

Anyway what is your opinions on this. he hasnt contacted me so its odvious he want this to now be his....

> 
> I notice jovzin seems to now be doing the shuttle. I wasnt aware of this. Although it seems he knew I was reworking it.
> 
> I must admit he has done well with the textures and animations.
> 
> There is no point in having two shuttles. 
> 
> One would assume that he has taken my 1.0 compatibility work and built on that to make something better. Who knows.
> 
> Anyway what is your opinions on this. he hasnt contacted me so its odvious he want this to now be his....

I contacted each of you via PM informing the other of the work being done on this mod.

as I said on *his* shuttle thread... it makes no sense for 2 talented people working separately on the same mod.

We're a gaming/modding community.

Communities work together for a common cause.

He has mentioned some points that confuse me regarding Unity implementation and if you'd be willing to take on that challenge.

(*huh?...whaaa?*)

So again, instead of having two talented people either working on the same project separately 

**or worse....**

giving up because the other is doing it 

would be a nightmare to the community

His model of the shuttle looks like the one in this mod but he seems to be focusing on that

making it better, faster, stronger

maybe you guys can do something like, idunno, u work on the boosters/tanks he does the shuttle and then you both tweak each others?

(adding the Canadarm for instance)

I'm retired now, but I ran 2 companies once upon a time.

Last thing you wanna do is alienate creative/talented thinkers

TEAMWORK DAMMIT!

*....backs away from the podium*
